page.title: 02SOUTHERN SELSEY'S COASTLINE
page.content: Most of our coastal area is protected by a newly completed {sea-wall}and many groynes are built along the beaches.{West Beach}has flat stretches of sand and provides safe swimming.{East Beach}is pebbly and shelves down steeply into the sea. Local people swim here.{Selsey Bill separates East from West. Swimming is dangerous here because of the Bill's strong currents.There are many fishing boats,nets,lobster pots and huts along East Beach.Sub aqua divers,many from London,come to East Beach to set off to the{Mixon rocks}where they explore a quarry about 28 metres deep.Water skiing and wind surfing are seen along the coast. Houses have been lost into the sea from both beaches but{erosion has slowed since the sea-wall was built,although very high tides still cause damage.
